responses.text:
Admission Process for the B.Tech programme:
 1. Admission through JoSAA: 
 Admission to the B.Tech. programmes of the Institute are carried out each year On the basis of performance of the students in the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE-Main) by common counselling through Joint Seat Allocation Authority (JoSAA).
 2. Admission under DASA programme 
 3. Admission under Cultural Exchange Programme(ICCR) 
 4. Admission under Study in India Programme(SII)

responses.text:
Admission Process for MBA programme is as follows: 
 1. Admissions will be made on the basis of CAT/GMAT/CMAT/MAT/Institute test (70% weightage), Group Discussion (15% weightage), and Interview (15% weightage). At first, the seats will be filled from CAT/GMAT/CMAT/MAT Marks+GD+PI Score. Remaining vacant seats will be filled from Institute’s Test Marks+GD+PI Score.

response.text: If you missed your mid-semester exam, it's important to inform your course instructor or department as soon as possible. Depending on the reason (like medical emergencies), you may be allowed to apply for a re-exam or makeup test.Form forup exams are available on the website after the completion of mid semester examinations. Make sure to provide valid documentation if required (such as a medical certificate). Contact your class coordinator or HOD for further guidance.

intents.response:
NIT Jalandhar provides reservation, facilities, and academic support for PwD (Persons with Disabilities) students. A valid disability certificate is required to claim reservation and related benefits.

✅ PwD students are eligible for a reserved quota during admission.
✅ Facilities like accessible classrooms, ramps, elevators, hostel accommodations, exam writers/scribes, and extra time are available.
✅ Fee concessions and scholarships may apply based on eligibility.
✅ For help, students can reach out to the admission office or the Student Welfare section for PwD-specific queries.

Make sure to upload the correct documents during JoSAA/CSAB and stay in touch with official NITJ communication channels for updated support and assistance.

patterns: How much does the course cost?
What is the fee for this program?
How much does the course cost?

responses.text:
NIT Jalandhar BTech fees is INR 5 lakh. This is the tuition fee for all the BTech specialisations. Apart from the tuition fees, candidates also have to pay Hostel Charges and One-time Payable Security Fees. Candidates are advised to visit the official website for more details about fees. 
 Students have to pay their semester fee only through online mode (using Netbanking, Debit/Credit Card) by login to NITJ ERP System.

responses.text: Scholarships are available for students with outstanding academic performance or those in financial need. For more queries contact Office e-mail ID : scholarshipsection@nitj.ac.in

patterns: How do I apply for hostel accommodation?
How do I apply for hostel accommodation?
What amenities are included in the hostel?

responses.text:
Hostel accommodation is available for students. 
 First year - shared room of 4 students 
 Second and third year - shared room of 2 students 
 Final year - Single room based on availability on first come first serve basis.  
 The facilities of internet, reading room, indoor games, washing machines, fans, washing machines, geyser, water cooler etc. are available in every hostel. Each hostel has a guest room with all basic amenities that can be booked by students for their parents/guests through hostel clerk on the recommendation of warden of the hostel.

responses.text:
The Training and Placement Office (TPO) at our institute 2nd floor snackers building, is dedicated to providing students with the skills, resources, and opportunities to successfully enter the professional world. 
 Placement Highlights  : 
- 95% placement rate 
- 12 LPA average package 
- Internship conversion 85% 
- Highest package of Rs 60LPA secured by multiple students.
- Significant placements in IT, Core Engineering and consulting sectors. 
- Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Nvidia, Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Deloitte, Accenture among the top companies.

responses.text: Branch change at NIT Jalandhar is offered once a year after your first semester results. Eligibility is based on CGPA, seat availability, and department counseling. You must fill out the branch change form (available online), upload required documents (transcript, approval letter), and submit by the deadline. Counseling dates and detailed criteria (minimum CGPA, number of seats) are published on the official portal.

patterns: How to prepare for semester exams?

responses.text:
Exam Information for First Year Students:

- Two main exams per semester: Mid-semester  and End-semester 
- Passing criteria: Minimum 40% in theory and practical separately
- Grading system: 10-point scale (S=10, A=9, B=8, etc.)
- Back papers: Can reappear in next semester if failed
- Exam pattern: 3-hour written papers + practicals/vivas

Exam schedules are displayed on notice boards 3 weeks prior. Previous year papers available in central library.
